success.question_text: Which of these would be a good title for Justine’s report?

stimulus_1.text:
Justine wrote this report about parrots. Can you help her edit her report?
Read the report and answer the question.

stimulus_2.text:
*  *  *

Parrots are a colourful group of Australian birds. They are easy to spot because they are always flying around or feeding in large ________ groups. You don’t need to go to the bush to see them—parrots are even found in city ________ .

stimulus_3.text: A feature of parrots is their strong, curved ________ . Parrots eat seeds, nectar, fruit and pollen. Some eat insects when feeding their young. Most parrots live in lifelong pairs even though most parrots flock in ________ groups. Parrot couples are always close to each other, even after the breeding season. They play together, touch and cling to each other, and often feed each other.

stimulus_4.text:
The Rainbow Lorikeet is probably the most ________ of Australian parrots, and it is so common that locals often take it for granted. It have a green back, a red belly with yellow trim and a blue face with a red beak and eyes.

parrots are playful and live in large groups and would not like a long life kept in a cage, ________ when alone—don’t buy one for a pet. It is sad to see a large bird, such as a cockatoo, in a cage, where it can’t use its wings.

                           *  *  *

success.question_text: Some words have been left out. Choose the best word to fill the space highlighted in green.

choice_2.label: The first word (parrots) should have a capital letter.

choice_3.label: There should be a full stop after groups.

choice_4.label: The word (pet) should have a capital letter.

success.question_text: The last paragraph has a suggestion. What is this suggestion?

choice_2.label: Parrots will chew through plastic clotheslines.

choice_3.label: Parrots should be free for everyone to enjoy.
